result.execSummary:
Tyrone Mathis was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Tyrone Mathis was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyrone Mathis

defendant.name: Mathis, Tyrone
defendant.address: 8951 North Park Plaza Court, Brown Deer, WI 53223

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Fred Richardson in court.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Defendant has been turned over to the State of INDIANA on 03.06.2022
On motion of the state, Court ordered case closed.

Defendant Tyrone Mathis in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Tyrone Mathis in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tyrone Mathis appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 2.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of rights and right to file a Writ of Habeas Corpus.  Court found the defendant is the person wanted in the State of Indiana.  Defendant waived extradition.  Signed Waiver of Extradition received and filed.  Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/0a25f782-7319-dd31-4ed9-c0f452a2bc2b  Status conference scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Criminal Warrant for Commitment.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
